data.title: Android: some textures are messed or missing after Lock screen
data.body:
Hello, I have discovered a strange issue in MonoGame and Android.

When I **lock and unlock the screen** (when the game is running); on selected devices some textures are missing - or even very different images are shown! It is a very rare issue, most of the time the game is OK. Hovewer sometimes these textures get very messed. Even some SpriteFonts are shown instead of some textures sometimes.

![bug1](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2102344/3299951/be4d2bdc-f61a-11e3-9237-c09b512cb251.png)

I use current MonoGame, the main branch develop. Some older version of the MonoGame (from May 2013) had the same problem.

I can reproduce this error on my Nexus 5 (Android 4.4) and Nokia X (AOSP 4.1.2), but I do not see this error on a Samsung Galaxy S3 (Android 4.3).

![bug2](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/2102344/3299953/ca50e39c-f61a-11e3-9b65-7d23300f3d77.png)

These textures get messed when I **lock and unlock the screen** during the game (approximately in 70% cases everything is OK after that, otherwise at least one texture is missing or broken). 

When I **switch** from my game **to another app and switch back**, everything is OK! Textures are loaded correctly and the problem is no longer here.

I use approximately 270 different textures in the game (but only some of them are loaded at one moment), = approximately 1.67 MB in PNG files. I load texture directly via TitleContainer.OpenStream().

.

LOG for lock / unlock the screen:

```
06-16 19:26:21.973 I/MonoGame(18332): android.intent.action.SCREEN_OFF

06-16 19:26:53.465 I/MonoGame(18332): android.intent.action.SCREEN_ON
06-16 19:26:54.995 I/MonoGame(18332): android.intent.action.USER_PRESENT
```

LOG for switching to another app and back:

```
06-16 19:28:10.605 D/MonoGame(18332): MonoGameAndroidGameView.DestroyFrameBuffer
06-16 19:28:10.625 D/MonoGame(18332): MonoGameAndroidGameView.SurfaceDestroyed

06-16 19:28:44.395 D/MonoGame(18332): MonoGameAndroidGameView.CreateFrameBuffer
06-16 19:28:44.395 D/MonoGame(18332): Creating Color:Default Depth:24 Stencil:0
06-16 19:28:44.405 D/MonoGame(18332): Created format Index: 489689698, Color: 32 (8888), Depth: 24, Stencil: 8, Samples: 0, Accum: 32 (8888), Buffers: 0, Stereo: False
06-16 19:28:44.405 D/MonoGame(18332): Framebuffer Status: FramebufferComplete
06-16 19:28:44.405 D/MonoGame(18332): MonoGameAndroidGameView.SurfaceCreated: surfaceFrame = Rect(0, 0 - 1080, 1776)
```

.
As you can see from the log, when I switch to another app, methods DestroyFrameBuffer and CreateFrameBuffer are called, as well as SurfaceDestroyed and SurfaceCreated. Hovewer when I just lock the screen and unlock it, none of these method is called...

I think it could be the problem. Can methods DestroyFrameBuffer and CreateFrameBuffer be called even on lock / unlock? How can I call them? How can I clear these graphical buffers?

.
**More info:** It seems that this problem does not depend on free memory in the phone. Even when I perform a clean install of the app and a phone reboot, and all other apps are closed, this problem persists. It does not depend also on how long the phone has been in a sleep mode; even very fast lock/unlock of the screen can cause this error.

I hope you can help me with it :)

Similar issues: https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/993 https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2427

data.title: Added image attaching for iOS Guide's Twitter
data.body: Added the ability to attach images to tweets in the iOS Guide Twitter method

data.title: Memory leak in Windows Desktop Projects
data.body:
First I would like to say I love the new version of MonoGame!

I believe I have found a memory leak in the Windows Desktop projects of MonoGame.

If I create just a blank Windows OpenGL project and just let it run it seems to consume ~4 to ~100 KB of memory every second or so regardless of activity on the screen.

If I create just a blank Windows DirectX project and just let it run, it on occasion consumes ~4 to ~8 KB of memory, but not very often. If I move my mouse on the screen, then I have the memory leaks and it is ~4 to ~100 KB every second.

I have seen the GC come by and collect some garbage but it is typically only  8KB or so, it also doesn't happen very often.

I am using 3.2 of MonoGame in Visual Studio 2012 on a Windows 7 machine.

MonoGames was gotten from the installer on the website.

data.title: Updated MojoShader
data.body:
Updated the 64bit version of MojoShader for Windows to fix issues with sampler marshalling.

Fixes #2666.
Fixes #2589.

data.title: Content processor issue
data.body:
I wanted to test the dev build (from today 773). Seems that the content processor has a issue with non power of two images. My terrain heightmaps are 129x129 bitmaps. After rebuilding the test project with the monogame dev build, the heightmap seems to be corrupted. Note the diagonal pattern on the terrain:
![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1684961/3278255/23c88b7a-f3b2-11e3-8503-6185b1d90c3e.jpg)
Such patterns are usually the result of one ore more pixels shifted.
Long story short, tried enabling the "resize to power of two" option and the terrain looked normal again. 
Also there might be a problem with the premultiplied alpha or color key. The reddish light billboard in the top mid is supposed to be fully transparent except for central circel - but I need to investigate that further.

data.title: Everything is black
data.body: I've created a new solution and everything is black. I'm using Linux (3.14), MonoDevelop 4.2.2 and MonoGame 3.2. The app does not crash, but it shows nothing at all.

data.title: Add Obscured/Unobscured listeners
data.body:
So we know when popups are in front of us.
We set IsActive=false while a popup is obscuring us, as per WP7 behavior:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.game.isactive.aspx

Fixes #2709

data.title: Improved video content pipeline
data.body: This links in the new ffmpeg binary dependency for all three platforms and ensures the video content pipeline calls into them to get video metadata. Parsing of metadata is also improved using the more machine-readable INI output option.

data.title: Game.Exit hangs if Mouse.GetState is called
TouchPanel Tests and Fixes
data.body:
This PR adds a complete set of UnitTests for the TouchPanel including the gesture recognition.
Please see #2579 for discussion on the tests. The commits since then are the refactoring required to fix the TouchPanel implementation.

TouchPanelState has been changed so instead of queuing up events for processing it processes them as they come in. This means we don't lose touches if you don't call GetState for a while (or if a touch starts and begins in between).

Currently the TouchPanel tests are only included in MonoGame.Tests.Windows, but they could be included in the others as they are not platform dependant.

Fixes #2579
Fixes #2076

Enjoy :-)

data.title: Game.IsActive not working on WP8
data.body:
I ported a game from WP7 to WP8 using MonoGame and my game is not paused when something obscure the game (like an alarm). This obviously is not acceptable as the user lose the game when this happen.

You can reproduce the issue easily.

I created an XNA Windows Phone project in Visual Studio 2012 and the following code in the Update method.

```
Debug.WriteLine("Game.IsActive " + IsActive);
```

I created an alarm few minutes in the future and I ran the game. The output windows shows "Game.IsActive true" and then turn into "Game.IsActive false" as soon as the alarm start.

The same exact code does not work on MonoGame in Visual Studio 2013.

Is there an easy way to solve this problem?
Is it possible to fix this?

Thanks

data.title: Missing classes in Microsoft.Framework.Design
data.body:
For reference:
http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Design(v=xnagamestudio.40).aspx

We currently have Vector2/3/4TypeConverter (though whether or not they behave exactly like XNA has not been thoroughly verified).

There is also a weird StringToColorConverter currently in the Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Content.Pipeline.Builder.Converters namespace which should 'probably' be the Framework.Design.ColorConverter.

data.title: Framework.Design VectorConverters
data.body:
Moved Vector2/3/4TypeConverter to Framework/Design.
Added to/from string for Vector2/3/4 converters.

data.title: ContentTypeReader Caching
data.body:
This is a fix for https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/issues/2687.

In this PR I established a static cache of `ContentTypeReader`s so that we don't continue to create and release them over and over on each call to `ContentManager.Load<T>()`.  This is not only a big reduction in garbage generation, but it also should slightly improve performance.

I also included a major refactor of `ReflectiveReader<T>` which moves all the reflection and other guess work into initialization.  This means reading the content does as little work possible which is a huge win on games that have lots of reflective types.

Also ran across a fix for `EnumWriter<T>` which I included here.

data.title: TypeConverters in Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Design namespace
data.body:
So I noticed a few new files like this one in the recent commits...

https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/blob/develop/MonoGame.Framework.Content.Pipeline/Vector2TypeConverter.cs

... which I found interesting, because I have something just like it in the main assembly:

https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/blob/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/Vector2.cs#L662

Looking at MSDN, turns out there's a whole namespace called Microsoft.Xna.Framework.Design that covers for all these TypeConverters:

http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/microsoft.xna.framework.design.aspx

It looks like we ended up making two separate TypeConverters that are actually public in the spec! We should probably merge our converters together and place them in MonoGame.Framework/Design/, and get the rest of those converters written (I assume the content pipeline is going to care about all these?).

Here are all my converters, for reference:
https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/blob/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/Vector2.cs#L662
https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/blob/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/Vector3.cs#L981
https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/blob/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/Vector4.cs#L779
https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/blob/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/Color.cs#L1918
https://github.com/flibitijibibo/MonoGame/blob/monogame-sdl2/MonoGame.Framework/Point.cs#L146

data.title: Implement video passthrough in content pipeline
data.body:
This adds support for video passthrough in the content pipeline. The VideoContent object acquires metadata  for the VideoContent object by parsing output from ffprobe (part of FFMPEG).

For the processor phase, no transcoding is performed. It could be done with FFMPEG, but video authoring is such a specialized process, I imagine most authors will want to use their own tools for it.

data.title: PipelineTool PropertyGrid Usability
data.body:
ContentItem.Processor property is expanded by default in the property grid.

When PropertyGrid updates in response to a selection change:
- selected property / griditem is synchronized
- expanded griditems are synchronized

Selection.Modified signature changed.

data.title: iOS - mp3 SoundEffect sounds like static
data.body:
MP3s in our game played as a SoundEffect are playing static, you probably need to try our repro to hear it.

Here is a project playing one of our sounds every two seconds: https://github.com/jonathanpeppers/MonoGameSounds

They worked on older versions of MonoGame, we were using source code from around the 3.0 timeframe. If I use an XNB instead, it works fine, but I'd rather use mp3 to keep our game smaller.

data.title: Model import/process fixes.
data.body:
NodeContent.Identity was not set in some cases.
Converting vertex channel types now supports a lot more formats
-Vector2/3/4 -> any format

data.title: PipelineTool output window line-wrapping.
data.body:
Disabled horizontal scroll bars.
Added a small hanging indent value.
Overriding default word-wrap so that it wraps individual characters instead of words (try with this off and you'll see why I'm doing it).

data.title: Multi-select property editing.
data.body:
Fixed remaining issues with multi-select property editing.
Implemented undo/redo for project properties (eg, outputdir, references, etc).
Note: Cannot undo changes made during a multi-select, yet.

data.title: SoundEffect/SoundEffectPool Fixes
data.body:
A few fixes for unexpected issues from https://github.com/mono/MonoGame/pull/2677.
- Fixed `SoundEffect.GetPooledInstance()` to set the `_effect`.
- Unified the work `SoundEffect.Play()`, `SoundEffect.Play(float, float, float)`, and `SoundEffect.GetPooledInstance()` do.
-  `SoundEffect.Play()` no longer does the extra work to set volume, pitch, and pan.
- Removed redundant setting of `_effect.
- `_playingInstances` and `_pooledInstances` both get default capacities now.
- Better calculation of default pool capacity that doesn't require #ifs.
- We now handle exhausting the sound pool in Xact.

data.title: MediaPlayer - playingInternal is irrelevant
data.body:
In the MediaPlayer.WP.cs file, the "playingInternal" variable which is defined in MediaPlayer.cs never takes on any value other than false. There is no need to have this check in MediaPlayer.WP.cs.

Unless I am missing something?? I think this variable might have come from @nezz recent media player changes?

data.title: Fixing PipelineTool File > 'New Project'
data.body:
Fixing 'New Project'.
Fixed crazy naming of click handlers.

data.title: iOS - sounds stop playing after locking screen
data.body:
I think this applies to both `SoundEffect` and `Song`, so if you lock the screen or background the app all sounds cease until you restart the app.

We were using the latest on the develop branch. We can try the stable 3.2 version, but we had another issue on Android that was fixed by using what is currently on the develop branch.

data.title: Fix for wrong line endings in pipeline tool output
Remove unused parts of AndroidCompatibility
data.body: We no longer support ES1 or resizing images to power of 2, so remove the variables for these settings.

data.title: GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges changing window size.
data.body:
GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges should not be triggering the window to resize, this is only a backbuffer resize operation.

In standard XNA one can hook into Window.OnClientBoundsChanged and initiate a backbuffer resize with GraphicsDeviceManager.ApplyChanges. But in MonoGame this triggers an infinite loop do to this line.

data.title: Fix to PipelineTool contentproj import.
data.body: Importing a contentproj would miss copy items which were set as "None" build action or if the CopyToOutputDirectory property was missing (default value should be copy if newer)..
